metadata.title: CVE-2018-10871 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
389-ds-base before versions 1.3.8.5, 1.4.0.12 is vulnerable to a CleartextStorage of Sensitive Information. By default, when the Replica and/orretroChangeLog plugins are enabled, 389-ds-base stores passwords inplaintext format in their respective changelog files. An attacker withsufficiently high privileges, such as root or Directory Manager, can querythese files in order to retrieve plaintext passwords.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.4.0.13-1
389-ds-base - 1.4.0.13-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.4.0.13-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.4.0.13-1
python3-lib389 - 1.4.0.13-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.0.13-1').
